fields.description: When adding a link towards a confluence page to an issue, it is impossible to search through the linked confluence on demand instance. The only working option is to add the complete url because no pages or spaces are shown/found.
fields.summary: Can't search for confluence pages from within JIRA issue navigator
Unable to add Team Calendars results in licensing error

fields.description: There is no possible now to see the tasks of specified Epic in Jira OnDemand. We always clicks on the Epic name in the task for listing all tasks in the Epic, but now it's not work!
fields.summary: impossible to view tasks in Epic
Unable to access Confluence - MissingConfluenceLicenseValidationException

fields.description: Viewing a single Epic is not showing the issues within the epic. However, if we search for issues where "Epic Link" = ID, we can see the items.
fields.summary: Issues in epic are not showing

fields.description:
I believe it would be great to replace built-in BitBucket issues tracker with powerful Jira. Right now it's not very practically useful connection between Jira and BitBucket. 

What I want to see is an option to disable built-in issues tracker and turn on Jira integration. So issues from Jira will be displayed on BitBucket issues tab. 

ps: by the way, where is project "BitBucket" or component "BitBucket" because this issue is related more to BitBucket.
fields.summary: Display issues from Jira on BitBucket issues tab

fields.description:
Currently we state in some docs of our OnDemand:
- [Integrating JIRA Cloud with Stash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Securing+Stash+with+Tomcat+using+SSL]
Note that your Stash application must be accessible through port 80 (or port 443 with *a valid SSL certificate*)

However, the list of CA authorities is available in a different document:
- [Restricted Functions in Atlassian OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand#RestrictedFunctionsinAtlassianOnDemand-JIRA]
{quote}
||Restricted Function||Configurable on Request?||Notes||
|Installing intermediate SSL certificates|NO|It is not possible to install intermediate certificates in JIRA Cloud. The potential impact might be that you will run into problems when adding secure POP/IMAP mail servers that have certificates signed by non-root CAs.
The workaround is to obtain a certificate signed by a trusted root Certification Authority (CA). The full list is [here|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/tools/solaris/keytool.html#cacerts].|
{quote}

Thus, can we link which CA authorities we accept as valid certificates to the pages *like* [Integrating JIRA Cloud with Stash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Securing+Stash+with+Tomcat+using+SSL]?
fields.summary: Make clear which CA authorities we accept in OnDemand - Cloud

fields.description:
# *Try other Atlassian apps* appears in App Switcher, and customers view this as an unwanted advertisement.
# ACE has confirmed it's not part of their advertising.
# This also displays for non-admin users, which I feel is an unwanted behaviour.
# It is possible to hide it forever but this only does it for the existing user.

More importantly, only show this for those who have billing access. Secondary would be to have a way to turn it off by default for all users.
fields.summary: Ability to disable "Try other Atlassian apps" from App Switcher for all users

fields.description: I cannot get my permissions to give my super-administrator access. I administer our ondemand instance, but I am unable to see majority of our spaces and I'm not sure why. I've triple checked my permissions - global and space but problem is not solved.
fields.summary: Permissions changes not reflecting

fields.description:
When I try to clone an issue… there seems to be something messed up with our JIRA database, can we escalate this with them? It all seems to be related to
 
admin.errors.exception com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankIntegrityException: Expected the first rank row to be of type MAXIMUM_MARKER_ROW. Found row[LexoRankRow{id=8023, fieldId=10900, issueId=21969, lockHash='null', lockTime=null, rank='0|zzzzzz:i', type=ISSUE_RANK_ROW}]

Can someone check it ASAP?
thanks
-David
fields.summary: error on clone an issue

fields.description:
Newly provisioned instance still contain the 'users' and 'developers' group.

[Default groups and permissions in Atlassian OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Default+groups+and+permissions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand] mention these were no longer required after Feb 2014.  Accordingly, these defunct groups are not associated to any permissions in a newly provisioned instance.

Can 'users' and 'developers' be removed from all future provisioned OnDemand instances to reduce confusion for customers.

Update 'Importing Users' documentation's queries

fields.description: OnDemand instances do not allow external connections on ports outside of 80 or 443. When an Application Link is created to a behind-the-firewall instance on a port other than 80 or 443, the OnDemand instance should provide an error message that this is not supported instead of allowing the link to be created (which won't work).
fields.summary: Application Link to a non-standard port should not be allowed

fields.summary: Cannot close out sprint with incomplete issues

fields.description:
Usernames can not start with a zero.

If there is a username that starts with a zero when you go into User Management >> Click on the User you will get an error saying that the user does not exist. The reason is because JIRA strips the zero from the username. 

For Example:

User: 01234

User Management will strip the 0 so it thinks the user is 1234. This will give an error because there is no user 1234. Now since you can the user ; the real issue is you can delete the user nor get any details like what groups the user would be in.

You have to go into the database and remove the user.
fields.summary: Usernames can not start with a zero

You would provide a single menu for the customer to view their account details and subscriptions while in-app.

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
The user tier when trying to add plugin, the price displayed in the OnDemand marketplace is not showing the correct price matching the user tier of the instance. However, the customer will be charged the correct tier at the end of the trial.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Subscribe to a new instance (Not sure if this affects current instances as well)
# Go to *Admin > Add-Ons > Find New Add-Ons*
# Start a free trial 

h3. ***Current Behavior***
The plugin trials are started with 2000 user tiers. For example, when an instance on 10 users tier instance adds a trial for ["Multiexcerpt Plugin"|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/biz.artemissoftware.confluence.multiexcerpt.MultiExcerptMacro#ondemand] it shows $50(2000 users) instead of $5.

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
The plugin trials should match the user tier for the instance.
fields.summary: User Tier for Plugin Subscription does not Match the User Tier for the Instance

fields.description:

My suggestion: perform a background reindexing automatically at the end of the automatic update run, if an indexing is required.
That is all. :)
fields.summary: Perform Background Re-Index After Automatic Update

fields.description:
When adding a user to the administrators and/or site-admins groups, after pressing "Add group" nothing happens.

*Cause*
Both administrators and site-admins group membership requires application access. If the user in question does not have application access to either JIRA or Confluence, it will get access granted to the application.

When the application to which the user requires access does not have any license slots available any more, nothing will happen. No error message will get presented, the Add group dialogue will remain in screen without any apparent changes made.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user to a JIRA+Confluence OnDemand instance where either one of the applications has reached its limit
# Look up the user in User Management
# Open the Add group dialogue
# Add user to administrators or site-admins and click "Add group"

In the browser dev console you will see the /admin/rest/um/1/user/group/direct?username=[username] post receive an error 400
The response message will read {code}{"genericErrors":["JIRA - you have reached the license limit for this application. You have no seats left, but require one to add this user to these group(s): administrators."]}{code}
fields.summary: Unable to add user to administrators or site-admins

fields.description: We're having trouble accessing parts of our Projects on JIRA. Access is being restricted where it wasn't before. Please let us know what can be done to remedy this, thanks!

Result:
No application navigator appears in Confluence, going to {{yourinstance.atlassian.net/builds}} shows Bamboo is running

*Workaround*
Go to https://YOURINSTANCEHERE.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator 
and manually add a link to https://YOURINSTANCEHERE.atlassian.net/builds/
fields.summary: If Bamboo is added to a Confluence-only instance the App-switcher will not display a link to Bamboo

fields.description:

When this happens, when you attempt to give another user Application Access, it is not possible to select an application. 

Displaying the number of users the license has been exceeded by (in the case of the screen shot attached -6) does not necessarily make it clear that the licensed user count has been exceeded.
fields.summary: Display a more meaningful error when confluence (or other) user tier has been exceeded

fields.summary: Cannot add group to user

fields.description:
Users are receiving the following message when trying to create an issue: "You will not be able to create new issues because the user limit for your JIRA instance has been exceeded, please contact your JIRA administrators." 

This is happening because when a V3 add-on is installed in the instance, a user is created and added to the *jira-users* group. Since this is the group that grants access to JIRA, one of the licenses is consumed by the user.

Also, the add-ons are added to the *atlassian-addons-admin* group, and this group is granted JIRA Administrators Global Permission, which also consume one of the user licenses

*Workaround:*

# Identify the members of the atlassian-addons group at: https://instancenamehere.atlassian.net/admin/groups/view?groupname=atlassian-addons
# Uninstall all add-ons that have users that are members of this group. This can be done from https://instancenamehere.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm#manage (JIRA).
fields.summary: You will not be able to create new issues because the user limit for your JIRA instance has been exceeded, please contact your JIRA administrators when trying to create an issue

fields.description:
I created a backups of OnDemand versions of Jira and Confluence.
But I cannot download created files.
It requires weird authentication.
!auth.png!

It doesn't accept my jira login credentials.
A couple of month ago everything worked.

Please, help.
fields.summary: Cannot Download a Backup File

fields.description:
When an instance uses the maximum number of licenses available and there is an add-on login present, which is a member of the atlassian-addons and the jira-user group, a license gets consumed.
The application license balance does not show a negative number.

The customer gets an license exceeded error and cannot create new issues. 

Removing the application access (which will remove the login from jira-user) for those add-on logins helps temporary, but a restart of the instance will add those add-on logins again to the jira-user group, and the problem reoccurs.

This only appears to be the case with customer instances after the recent UUM upgrade.
Instances that already used the UMM don't appear to have this problem.
fields.summary: logins created by addons in the atlassian-addons group consume a license.

fields.description:
# Access User Management in IE (test version 8)

fields.summary: IE Throws Security Errors Accessing User Management

fields.summary: Invalid credentials error for users previously deactivated before the new User Management Module

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 29 September 2021}

Hi everyone,

This is an update to let you know that we will now be transitioning this request to closed :) We have completed shipping the site rename feature and it’s now available to you via the Admin Hub (admin.atlassian.com).

A quick reminder that renaming your site does not release the old name for reuse. When you update a site’s URL, we store the previous URL in your site’s history to enable redirects.

Please follow this page for further details and instructions on how you can access the feature: https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/update-a-product-url/ 

Thanks,
Atlassian product management

{panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 27 May 2019}
Hi everyone,
Our team is currently working through all site rename requests that have been raised via Support. At this moment in time, the expected turnaround time for a site rename request to be actioned is five business days. In preparation for a site rename, please do not attempt to reserve your preferred name by signing up for a new site. This creates extra complexity in the process and will prolong the time required before your site can successfully be renamed. 

  We are also actively working on verifying the compatibility of vendor add-ons with this feature. This is an ongoing process and you can follow the progress on this ticket [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-10809].

  Thanks,
Atlassian product management 

{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 April 2019}
Hi everyone

It's been a .... long time between updates. 2 years, 4 days, for those counting. Those of you who saw our latest update on CLOUD-6999 (which was also a long time ago, admittedly) will know that, despite the lack of visible external progress, there has been a team of Atlassians working gradually through these two tickets - and to that effect, I'm pleased to announce that we've shipped the first iteration of being able to rename a Cloud site, as was announced today at Atlassian Summit in Las Vegas. Key highlights:
 * Rename requests will be actioned via a support request. Support will review eligibility criteria prior to triggering a rename
 * Once Support have confirmed that the site is eligible to be renamed, they will work with the customer to schedule the site rename. It may take up to 5 minutes before the change has fully propagated through various internal systems.. Any access to an old name will be redirected to the new name (e.g. clicking on a link from an email notification sent prior to a site being renamed)
 * We have tested the renaming capabilities with a number of core Ecosystem Connect add-ons. We've proven these to work as expected after a rename, however given the number of installed Connect apps we expect there could be some cases where rename breaks these apps. We're continuing to work through the remaining list of top add-ons, as we move towards a self-serve solution. 
 * We will maintain a history of names associated with a Cloud site, up to a maximum of four previous names. We are not recycling these names currently, however we may choose to do so in the future
 * Mobile apps may require users to log out and log back in after a Cloud has been renamed. This is a known limitation with our solution, which we're looking to address in the coming months

We're finalising external documentation updates currently, and I'll post a link to it here once that process has been completed. 

I want to thank the broader community for your patience while we've worked our way through this problem, and acknowledge some of the comments that have come up on this ticket, especially in the last day or so regarding how long it's taken us to finally reach this point. We're acutely aware of the pain this has been causing customers, in a variety of scenarios, and are looking forward to providing some relief to that, delayed as it has been. 

We'll be leaving this ticket open as we progress towards a fully self-service experience for administrators. Please raise a Support ticket if you encounter issues when using this functionality. 

Cheers
 Nuwan Ginige
 Atlassian Product Management
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 7 April 2017}
Hi everyone

A quick update - we've started work on some foundation services on top of which we'll build the ability to rename a JIRA and Confluence Cloud site. Once we've completed these foundations, we'll focus on allowing sites to be renamed via a support request, before eventually exposing this as a self-serve capability via Site Administration.

Note that this particular change only allows you to change the site name (e.g. from {{foo.atlassian.net}} to
 {{bar.atlassian.net}}). This does not allow you to apply a custom domain to your site - please watch for CLOUD-6999 for future progress on our custom domain capabilities.
  
 I'll update this ticket once the first set of customers are eligible to rename their site via a support request, and more comprehensive documentation is available.

Cheers
 Nuwan
 Atlassian Product Management

We receive a lot of requests for new features and improvements, so if you'd like to better understand how we make roadmap decisions, please read: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html]
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 13 February 2017}
Hi everyone

Firstly, thank you to all commenters, watchers and voters on this ticket for your support for this feature. We realise we've been pretty quiet on this particular ticket, and an update is definitely overdue - after internal review, we're planning to commence work on this feature in the next couple of months (April 2017), once we've completed work on some existing priorities. We've seen the challenges customers have faced with using the suggested export/import workaround to rename their sites, and we're looking to fix this in a more sustainable manner.

I'll update this ticket once we've commenced work on this feature, and we have some more information to share regarding intended behaviour and our rollout strategy. As usual, roadmaps are subject to change.

Thanks again for your patience,
 Cheers
 Nuwan
 Atlassian Product Management

We receive a lot of requests for new features and improvements, so if you'd like to better understand how we make roadmap decisions, please read: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html]
{panel}
Currently customers are not able to easily change their Atlassian Cloud URL (domain).

This might be required if a company name changed, the purpose of the instance changes, or there was a typo in the original name.

This should be made this easier to create a better customer experience.
h2. Workaround:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Changing+the+Cloud+Instance+URL+Address+or+Migrating+to+a+New+Cloud+Instance]
fields.summary: More Easily Change Atlassian Cloud URL Domain

fields.description:
# In OnDemand instance, in either Confluence or JIRA
# Click Help > What's New
# Get pop-up with Page Not Found.
# Right-click the What's New and Copy Link Address, get {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/whatsnew/iframe?utm_campaign=yuX3vawa&utm_medium=navbar&utm_source=inproduct}}
# {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/What's+New}} seems like it MIGHT be the address it ultimately needs, but {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/whatsnew}} does not work.
fields.summary: What's New Dialogue Page Not Found

fields.description:
1. User 1 was created.
2. Password and login is defined.

User can log in jira but not confluence. Checkbox Confluence user is checked.
All groups to obtain permissions is added.

The bug I guess in the system. Some secrions in admin menu is duplicated in Confluence admin panel.
fields.summary: Jira-Confluence-Failed users permissions

fields.description:
Hello, I've talked to your support team and the told me to raise a ticket, I've been trying to loggin to my account all afternoon but couldn't, a sign appears that says: Su cuenta no está disponible todavía en esta instancia de OnDemand. (Your account is not avaliable in the OnDemand instance yet"). I Attached the picture.

I really need to login to my account t keep up with my work, ¿can someone please solve this?
fields.summary: Problem logging into account

fields.description: Our instance of confluence is missing the App Navigator, Create Page and all Menu Items that used to appear on the top blue bar - Please help
fields.summary: App Navigator, Create Page Missing

fields.description:
When a watched issue is updated, it would be very useful if the subject line could indicate the type of update, i.e., whether a worklog has been added, a comment edited, or whatever:
{code}
[JIRA WorklogAdd] (ABC-22) Users cannot X with feature Y enabled
[JIRA CommentEdit] (ABC-22) Users cannot X with feature Y enabled
[JIRA FileDelete] (ABC-22) Users cannot X with feature Y enabled
[JIRA ScreenshotAdd] (ABC-22) Users cannot X with feature Y enabled
.
.
.
{code}
This would be a great help when working through a list of email notifications, since the list would be much more informative, and depending on the watcher's role, reading the subject line alone would often be sufficient.
fields.summary: Include change type in subject line of issue update notification email

fields.description:
Hello!

For some of our users autocomplete function does not work. Please check and fix it.
See related CONF-33244.

Thanks!
fields.summary: User autocomplete does not work for some of our users

fields.description:
In OnDemand, If you have a Confluence and you decided to get JIRA as well per default you will be redirected to JIRA application every time you log in.

So if you uses Confluence more often than JIRA everytime you put your credentials you will need to change it to use Confluence in the application navigator.

Would be desirable to have a way to select which product will be the default one to open when customers log in using their on demand account.
fields.summary: Make possible to choose a default site when owning multiple products.

fields.description:
Currently I don't have a way to run a report for an individual user that shows what the original estimate and the actual time logged were.

Example: I have Engineer Steve. I would like to be able to run a report or have some view into all the tickets that have been assigned to him, what the original estimate was, and what the actual time logged was.
fields.summary: Create a report that shows a per user view of the tickets that the user has done,with the original estimate and the actual time spent

fields.description:
AOD upgrade completed on May 26th on our instance https://xpedxit.atlassian.net/ and now system admins cannot view uses under User Management.  User Mananagement page continues to clock without rendering.  Unable to user browser's back button to return to previous page.
System admins cannot add/edit/modify users on our instance.  Thank you in advance for your assitance.
fields.summary: User Management Site Clocking

fields.description:
Atlassian recently implemented a new user and group management console.

I just tried to delete a user using two different admin accounts, and got the same error:

"Delete user

vishwanadham.kotla@atmel.com cannot be deleted because of the following problems

Please resolve the following application references.

Confluence: Error communicating with Confluence: Unauthorized"
fields.summary: Cannot delete user from new OnDemand user management console

fields.description:
After the migration to the new Confluence version, all users that were disabled are no longer disabled.

This has two terrific consequences:
1) I guess those people are able to log-in again? If so, this is a major security flaw.
2) They seem to count against the license. The user page displays -27 (minus twenty seven) for the user count, and prevents me from adding new users, which basically makes the confluence instance unusable (we create 2 new accounts per week on average).
fields.summary: Disabled users no longer disabled?

fields.description: seems to have recently been moved - the refresh-results icon used to appear next to the issue count at the top of the list of issues, but now requires scrolling to bottom of the list to refresh. It is much more convenient to have this at the top of the list, and the result of it being moved is that I actually find it much easier to just trigger an entire page refresh in the browser rather than scroll to bottom and hit the results-refresh button specifically.
fields.summary: Refresh-results icon inconveniently moved to bottom of "issues" view page

fields.description: Last login date was deployed to OD for new UM, but dates are incorrect/incomplete.
fields.summary: Last Login data is incorrect for new User Management
